text:
If I use `insight-reports` or `asia-pacific` in the second argument, it pulls in the right content, so my feeling is I need to do more with that second argument
Using `topic.slug` didn't do the trick so any advice here would be greatly appreciated :slightly_smiling_face:
Hey everyone! Is there a way to set up a force redirect from non-www to www version of a site? It would be pretty easy with .htaccess but that's not an option in COS, right? Thank you!
<@UCBPF45EF> You can do this with most domain providers by creating a re-direct for the non-www to go to the www version of the website.
It essentially creates an A record for the non www domain.

Correct, however there are some hosts that are a little frustrating with this (bluehost is first to come to mind). I have sometimes had to forward my nameservers to something like CloudFlare or NameCheap in order to get access to "redirect" records. You can do this with a serverside language like PHP too, but I think doing it at the DNS / nameserver level is the cleaner approach if possible.

But would that work in a situation like this?

<http://domainname.com/xyz|domainname.com/xyz> to
<http://www.domainname.com/xyz|www.domainname.com/xyz>
You may need to set it up as a wildcard redirect (again, I think this depends on nameserver provider) but it should be possible
